entries.content: When calling a gatekeeper, understand their job is to screen calls for relevance to their boss, not to buy from you.
Approach gatekeepers by being quick and painless to help them efficiently screen the call for their boss.
Use the phrase: 'I need 15 seconds to see if this is even relevant for them.'
entries.notes: Highlights a short time commitment and frames the call as a relevance check.

entries.content: An alternative phrase for the gatekeeper is: 'Can I earn 15 seconds to see if this is even relevant to them?'
entries.notes: Emphasizes respect and earning their time.

entries.content: Using the word 'relevant' signals to the gatekeeper that the call is for screening purposes, not a sales pitch.
After the gatekeeper grants permission for 15 seconds, ask them a quick clarifying question about the prospect's focus.
Example clarifying questions for a gatekeeper: 'Are they still handling X?', 'Are they interested in Y?', 'Do they have issues with Z?'
entries.notes: Helps the gatekeeper categorize the call for the prospect.

entries.content: When the prospect answers, reference the gatekeeper by name to show you came through properly.
Prospect opening after gatekeeper: 'Hey [Prospect Name], I was just speaking to [Gatekeeper Name]. I earned 15 seconds. I wanted to see if this is relevant.'
Use the same clarifying question with the prospect that you used with the gatekeeper.
entries.notes: Example: '...I was speaking to [Gatekeeper Name] about [brief topic], are you still focused on that?'

entries.content: If the prospect confirms relevance: 'Great. Based on that, [briefly state your value proposition or reason for calling].'
If the prospect says the topic is not relevant: 'Okay, fair enough. I appreciate the 15 seconds. Have a great day.'
Maintain a crisp, clear, confident, yet humble tone, especially when speaking to gatekeepers.
entries.notes: Tone influences perception of professionalism and purpose.

entries.content: Do not try to sell or pitch the gatekeeper anything; focus solely on gaining access based on potential relevance.
